step.reason: \text{The appropriate way to expand } \\ \int \dfrac{f(x)+g(x)}{h(x)}\, dx = \int \dfrac{f(x)}{h(x)}\, dx+\int\dfrac{g(x)}{h(x)}\, dx \\ \text{However, }\int \dfrac{f(x)}{h(x)}\neq \dfrac{\int f(x)}{\int h(x)}

step.tex: \text{Using step 1}\\ \begin{align} \int \dfrac{x^3 + 5x^2 - 4 }{x^2}dx &= \int x\,dx + \int 5\,dx -\int \dfrac{4}{x^2}\,dx\\ &= \dfrac{x^2}{2} + 5 x +4\left(\dfrac{x^{-2 + 1}}{-2 + 1}\right) + C\\ &= \dfrac{x^2}{2} + 5 x -\dfrac{4}{ x} + C \end{align}\\ \text{Here , C is the constant of integration}
